704286f-a.text:
The Old Vanderveer House, Flatbush, Brooklyn
c. 1890
By W.R. Vanderveer
From P.L. Sperr Collection
Note: Under the subject heading:'Transportation - Sleigh' can be found a photo from this same series, showing the Vanderveer family sleighing, with the homestead in the background, ca. 1890.
See also the subject heading "Farming" (11 photos of Vanderveer farm)
704286f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Ditmas Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704287f-a.text:
Flower garden, Vanderveer farm. Flatbush, Brooklyn.
c. 1890.
By W.R. Vanderveer
From PL Sperr Collection
704287f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Ditmas Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704297f-a.text:
(1)
1249 Flatbush Ave., east side, between Ditmas and Newkirk Aves., showing Cortelyou House, erected about 1820, when it was occupied by S. Cortelyou, and later to be moved to 412 East 25th Street.
Prior to 1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, showing another view of the Garret Vanderveer House alias Cortelyou House. It was erected in 182O by Simon Cortelyou who was the son-in-law of Garret Vanderveer who owned the house in 1842.
Incorrect data, see The Cortelyou Genealogy by J.V. Cortelyou, 1942, p.295.
Prior to 1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3)
The same, from another angle.
Prior to 1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
